NAZI LITERATURE IN THE AMERICAS is a work of fiction by the Chilean author Roberto BolaÃƒÂ±o (1953-2003) and was the first of his books to reach a wide public.  When it was published by Seix Barral in 1996, critics in Spain were quick to recognize the arrival of an important new talent.  The book presents itself as a biographical dictionary of American writers who flirted with or espoused extreme right-wing ideologies in the twentieth and twenty-first centuries. It is a tour de force of black humor and imaginary erudition. 

The book is composed of short biographies, including descriptions of the writers' works, plus an epilogue ("for Monsters"), which includes even briefer biographies of persons mentioned in passing.
